title: Public administration, public leadership and the construction of public value in the age of the algorithm and ‘big data’
theoretical_background: Public value theory; Wicked problems theory
research_description: The article explores the governance challenges posed by the algorithmic and data-driven age, particularly for public leaders. It uses public value theory as an analytical framework to assess how leaders are addressing the ethical and governance challenges of algorithms.
research_results: The article identifies a number of challenges, such as algorithmic risks and governance issues, and proposes public value theory as a useful framework for addressing these issues in public administration.
future_research: Future research should explore the application of public value theory in broader governance contexts, particularly as new technologies like AI and big data continue to evolve.
